metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22761 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Web-accessible extension pages (pages with a moz-extension:// scheme) werenot correctly enforcing the frame-ancestors directive when it was used inthe Web Extension's Content Security Policy. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 97, Thunderbird < 91.6, and Firefox ESR < 91.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
